isis.stitle: TSI 00-12-06R - New Cylinder Head Bolts And Torque Values For All I6 HUEI Engines

subjectgroup.subject: New Cylinder Head Bolts And Torque Values For All I6 HUEI Engines

geninfo.para: A new cylinder head bolt and a procedure for checking and installing head bolts is released. The update only impacts the short head bolt changing from 1½ inches thread length (displaced) to 4 inches (new). Engines with serial number 1194039 and above have a new torque procedure and torque value. The only bolt available for service is the new bolt. Any torquing of cylinder head bolts on a new engine must follow the new Special Torque Sequence Chart.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. New 4 inch thread short cylinder head bolt.
2. Displaced 1½ inch thread short cylinder head bolt.

note.para: Some engines built prior to S/N 1194039 may have the new style head bolts. The new torque procedure applies to engines built after S/N 1194039 only.

para.hotlnk:
The new Special Torque Sequence Chart
gives the order and torque value when installing the new bolt on engines with S/N 1194039 and above.

geninfo.para:
When working with engines that have a serial number under 1194039 and contain the displaced style short bolt (with 1½ inches of thread), or the new style short bolt (with 4 inches of thread) follow the standard procedure for that equipment as described in Cylinder Head Bolt Special Torque Sequence Chart
of this bulletin or the engine service manual, Form EGES-160-1.

note.para: New and displaced bolts (if they meet the reusability test below) CAN be used on the same cylinder head. They must be torqued to the former specifications.

A Bolt Length Gauge is needed for the successful completion of this procedure. Contact the SPX Corporation ( )
for ordering information.

item.para: Spin nut onto the cylinder head bolt.
If the nut becomes hung-up on the threads, it means the bolt is stretched beyond limit and CANNOT be reused.
Discard and replace any cylinder head bolt that fails the reusability test with new cylinder head bolt.

svcproc.title: Tensioning Procedure For Engines With S/N 1194039 And Above

note.para: 4 inch thread Length SHORT Head Bolts must be used, Long Bolt thread length remains 1½ inch

Follow "Sequence A" steps 1 to 6 shown on the Engines with S/N 1194039 and above Special Torque Sequence Chart
.

figure.caption: Figure 2. Engines with S/N 1194039 and above Special Torque Sequence Chart

item.para: Apply 15W40 oil to clean bolts and washers
Torque all cylinder head bolts (long and short) to 100 ft·lbf (136 N·m) following sequence in Figure 2.
Torque all cylinder head bolts (long and short) to 130 ft·lbf (177 N·m) following sequence in Figure 2.

Add a paint mark
on each socket/bolt head and another mark 90° clockwise on the cylinder head surface.
Rotate each bolt 90° (until paint marks are aligned).

caution.para: Do not use chlorinated solvents on bolts or crankcase tapped holes. Parts should be clean and dry, free of any chemical residuals other than engine oil.

svcproc.title: Tensioning Procedure For Engines Before S/N 1194039

note.para: Either 1½ inch or 4 inch SHORT Head Bolts may be used. LONG Head Bolt thread length remains 1½ inch.
